Package org.netbeans.api.debugger.jpda

JPDA Debugger APIs provide representation of JDI functionality.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CallStackFrame
    Represents one stack frame.
    ClassVariable
    Represents an instance of java.lang.Class from the target VM.
    Field
    Represents one field.
    JPDAArrayType
    Represents type of an array in the debugged process.
    JPDAClassType
    Represents type of an object (class, interface, array) in the debugged process.
    JPDAThread
    Represents one Java thread in debugged process.
    JPDAThreadGroup
    Represents one Java thread group in debugged process.
    JPDAWatch
    Represents watch in JPDA debugger.
    LocalVariable
    Represents one local.
    MonitorInfo
    Represents one owned monitor.
    MutableVariable
    Represents a variable that can be modified.
    ObjectVariable
    Represents instance of some object in debugged JVM.
    ReturnVariable
    Represents a return value from a method.
    SmartSteppingFilter
    Defines list of class exclusion filters to be used to filter stepping in debugged session.
    Super
    Represents super class of some object and its value.
    This
    Represents "this" value for call stack frame.
    Variable
    Represents some variable in debugged JVM.
    VariableType
    The base type for variables.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractDICookie
    Abstract ancestor of all DebuggerInfo Cookies.
    AttachingDICookie
    Attaches to some already running JDK and returns VirtualMachine for it.
    ClassLoadUnloadBreakpoint
    Notifies about class load and class unload events.
    DeadlockDetector
    Service that detects deadlocks and fires an event when the deadlock occurs.
    DeadlockDetector.Deadlock
    Representation of a deadlock - one set of mutually deadlocked threads.
    ExceptionBreakpoint
    Notifies about exceptions throw in debugged JVM.
    FieldBreakpoint
    Notifies about variable change or access events.
    JPDABreakpoint
    Abstract definition of JPDA breakpoint.
    JPDADebugger
    Represents one JPDA debugger session (one VirtualMachine).
    JPDAStep
    Represents one JPDA step.
    LaunchingDICookie
    Launches a new JVM in debug mode and returns VirtualMachine for it.
    LineBreakpoint
    Notifies about line breakpoint events.
    ListeningDICookie
    Listens on given port for some connection of remotely running JDK and returns VirtualMachine for it.
    MethodBreakpoint
    Notifies about method entry events.
    ThreadBreakpoint
    Notifies about thread started and dead events.
    ThreadsCollector
    Collector of threads running inside the debuggee.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    DebuggerStartException
    Notification about problems during debugger start.
    InvalidExpressionException
    Notification about bad expression.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    JPDADebugger.Registration
    Declarative registration of a JPDADebugger implementation.

Package org.netbeans.api.debugger.jpda Description

JPDA Debugger APIs provide representation of JDI functionality. Interfaces in org.netbeans.api.debugger.jpda package correspond to appropriate JDI interfaces. 

Since JDI interfaces evolve from one version to another, it's strongly recommended
not to implement any interface in this package. New methods can be added to
these interfaces at any time to keep up with the JDI functionality.
